intro: Sinosenecio ligularioides, commonly known as the narrow-leafed sinosenecio, is a flowering plant native to China. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant features slender, lance-shaped leaves and produces small, yellowish flowers arranged in clusters. It thrives in moist, shady environments and is often found in mountainous regions. Due to its ornamental value and limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
